definitions.definition: (authorship) The course of a story, comprising a series of incidents which are gradually unfolded, sometimes by unexpected means.
An area or land used for building on or planting on.
A graph or diagram drawn by hand or produced by a mechanical or electronic device.
A secret plan to achieve an end, the end or means usually being illegal or otherwise questionable.
definitions.example: The assassination of Lincoln was part of a larger plot.

definitions.definition: Contrivance; deep reach thought; ability to plot or intrigue.
Participation in any stratagem or conspiracy.
To trace out (a graph or diagram).
definitions.example: They plotted the number of edits per day.

definitions.definition: To mark (a point on a graph, chart, etc).
definitions.example: Every five minutes they plotted their position.

definitions.definition: To conceive a crime, misdeed, etc.
definitions.example: They were plotting against the king.
